review: Nie

Spielzeit 11 Minuten. Ich habe nicht gespielt. Versuche mich noch immer einzuloggen!

Ich habe ein paar tausend Stunden Overwatch Spielzeit.
Dieses Spiel hat sich von richtig gut (Overwatch 1 2016) zu "Ich bin Blizzard, gebt mir Geld, wir hassen alle Spieler" gewandelt.

Kostenlos ist hier gar nichts! Es geht nur um das verkaufen. Es geht weder um das Produkt noch um die Spieler oder Spielspaß. Es gibt außer Aktionären auch niemanden mehr bei Blizzard den das interessieren würde. Blizzards Devise ist "Wie können wir am meisten Geld aus den dummen Spielern pressen?"

Die Firma Blizzard hat sich zu einem grausigen Monster gewandelt.

Das Spiel wäre eigentlich richtig gut. Nur leider hat es Blizzard geschafft alles zu einem großen Einheitsbrei zu verwandeln. Alle sind gut, alle sind Schadensausteiler, alle sind alles.
Blizzard hat es verpasst den neuen Spielern zu zeigen worum es in diesem Spiel geht und wie man es spielt. Jeder macht was er will, kein Teamplay, kein ausnutzen von Taktiken. Nichts. Reinlaufen ballern, fertig. Gewinnen oder verlieren ist Zufall. Je nach dem in welchem Team es gerade mehr Glückspilze gibt.

Schade um dieses Spiel, schade um Blizzard. Ihr habt eure guten Leute rausgeekelt und den Aktionären die Macht überlassen. Rausgekommen ist eine Firma in der es nur noch um das abkassieren geht aber schon lange nicht mehr um die Spieler.

Back in 2016-2018, Overwatch was my favorite game, I have so many fond memories of staying up late playing ranked games, and drooling over gold guns. I made so many friends, enemies, and even worked my way up to grandmaster. But those days are long gone now. The battlepass was one of the worst decisions they could have made and the awful decisions the dev team continue to make in terms of monetization and balance have really dissuaded me from playing anymore. 

I think I will always have a soft-spot for this game, but I'm also left with a hole in my heart for how they're treating this game now.

I don't think I can recommend that anyone should start playing this game, even though I do still think it's fun at it's core. You'd be better off finding a new hobby.

Back in 2016, Overwatch was my favorite game to play. It dropped you into a 6v6 match and immediately made you play as a team with total strangers, something that was very rare in shooters. Everyone was playing the objective and giving it their all and I loved that. Over the next years, Overwatch was updated in such ways that it became unrecognizable from that original, base game. They added heroes that would release in a broken state and then would wait for a few months to make them balanced, they added Role Queue and Role Limits to stop players from having more than 2 support or more than 2 tanks which just made matchs feel more same instead of exciting, no longer were you worried that the enemy team just went 6 Mei which made the game less fun. Eventually, developers announced that OW2 would release with a full-blown PVE campaign. While they worked in Overwatch 2, the original got neglected for 5 years. No new heroes, no new maps, nothing.

Fast forward to today and that PVE campaign was cancelled. Leaving the most of us to wonder, what did they actually do during those 5 years? The changes from 1 to 2 are so minimal, lighting to maps? UI changes? No, they were working on a Shop because it OW1 wasn't selling enough. They removed a player slot so every game is 5v5 now because having 2 tanks was "unbalanced" despite the fact that 2 tanks was the norm for all of Overwatch's life.

The current OW2 experience is so far removed from that 2016 experience. You no longer get to stay around after a match to see a POTG and to vote for the MVP in a match, you're booted out from a match so that they can keep pumping playtime up and have players constantly rack hours. No downtime, no socializing with the enemy, no fun.

Would I recommend Overwatch 2 to a newcomer? No, the game doesn't resemble the game it was when it received the awards and praises. It's just a hollow shell bearing the resemblance of something that I used to love.

I stunk a lot of time into the original version of this game (Cause I can hardly call this a sequel) I'm VERY disappointed with how this over-glorified update turned out. What was once a shine of hope for the game to get new life quickly cracked away and showed that greed had taken over with the shop being a huge focus for Blizzard, with each season hot items being removed from battle passes and slapped with a price tag in the store removing a reason to grind the pass for many who bought the pass for that item.

There were many blunders had during the end of the first game which lead me to stop playing and with second game just spitting and shafting my hope of getting back into it with no PvE at start and ultimately canceling said PvE was the final straw for me. Insult to injury was when they said they'd bring in what they had but at a price and have it gutted of what was promised.

I'm horribly disappointed by this game as I did genuinely enjoy the first game a lot and a ton of that was due too Lucio and how he play, I've never had so much fun with a character in a shooter before, it's just such a shame how things turned out. I'm sorry they did you like this Lucio I will always love you my boy.

Hopefully steam doesn't flag this as review bombing because I have well over 500 hours into this game on Battlenet and I'm here to say this game isn't worth your time. I stopped playing shortly after Overwatch 2 because of all the broken promises and rampant monetization. Even played the game through the content drought and it was WAY better then instead of now. It might be "Free" but stay far away. There isn't a single aspect of this game that hasn't been  disrespected. 

For Gameplay they added the 2 with promise of a sprawling campaign and unique abilities just for the campaign mode all of that was canceled and replaced with what they've been doing for FREE events they now expect you to pay 15 bucks for.And they dropped a tank from team. Now 5v5 - All in favor of preserving their precious esports (which is closing down)

For Lore. They constantly change character motivations, sexuality and  plot lines at the drop of a hat. They even removed a comic regarding Pharah in favor of suddenly making her bisexual in a more recent lore dump. 

For Monetization. Probably the worst- I bought the big deluxe edition expecting to be given the campaign portion of Overwatch 2 and they've just decided to cancel that. Instead of giving the co-op content to deluxe buyers we just get nothing additional. It's constant broken promise after broken promise
